meanings.definition: To install (a monarch) on a throne.
meanings.sent1: The king was enthroned with great ceremony.
meanings.sent2: She enthroned her favorite book on the top shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully enthroned itself on the highest perch.
meanings.sent4: The sun, like a golden king, enthroned in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling crown enthroned on the queen's head shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To place in a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The new CEO was enthroned after the retirement of the previous one.
meanings.sent2: He enthroned his loyal advisor as the head of the council.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel enthroned itself as the ruler of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was enthroned in the eyes of her team.
meanings.sent5: The majestic eagle enthroned at the top of the food chain.
